alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 2:28AM CDT until May 11 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NACOGDOCHES, NORTHWESTERN SAN AUGUSTINE, WESTERN SHELBY, SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE AND SOUTHERN RUSK COUNTIES... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nacogdoches, Timpson, Garrison, Trawick, Melrose, Martinsville, Douglass, Sacul, New Salem, Appleby, and Cushing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby
